hypothesis_content.title: Futures Basis Short-Term Collapse Reversion in Bull/Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL or NEUTRAL regimes, a sharp, high-volume collapse in the quarterly BTC futures annualized basis (a drop of >50% from its 24-hour average) will revert by at least 50% of the initial drop within 6 hours, provided spot price is not in a free-fall (< -5% in 1h).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp basis compression in non-stress regimes is often caused by leveraged long liquidation in futures, not a breakdown of the long-term bullish funding structure. Market makers and basis traders will step in to capture the wide spread, pushing it back towards equilibrium.
entry_conditions: BTC Quarterly Futures Annualized Basis drops by >50% from its 24h average within 2 hours
Futures volume during drop > 120% of 20-period average
Spot BTC price decline over the last hour is < -5%

exit_conditions.take_profit: Basis recovers 50% of the initial measured drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Basis turns negative (backwardation) OR spot price drops >3% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The majority (>60%) of such sharp basis collapses lead to sustained backwardation or further compression in the following 6 hours, indicating a structural shift rather than a temporary liquidity event.
